The description makes it sound like the home sits on a secluded parcel of land which is not the case, there are neighbors all around. The furniture in the home looks and feels like garage sale leftovers. It feels like very little effort has been made to offer someone a warm welcome and comfort. Bare walls and bare floors, no rugs. The best thing about the house was the very large television with lots of streaming options. The house was clean for the most part, just very basic. We arrived with one small coverlet on the bed and two pillows. After searching we did find a couple more pillows and some pillowcases for extra comfort. I also found a spare blanket and was able to use the provided washer and dryer to launder it as it was found on the floor. Not sure I would choose this property over a nice hotel. One thing that I personally loved was there was no less than 5 sets of dishes one of which is a Christmas pattern and another a china set. Everything in an exact setting of four including your silverware.
There is no one but those listed on your reservation allowed on the property so if you wanted to have a visitor for coffee you are not permitted to do so and that was very disappointing. If you are there for just a visit to the area then this is a must stay location and you will not be disappointed in the rental.
Thank you Patrick and Toni for sharing your Millers Creek home with us.
